project_name: Use the user-provided project title or the first heading from the uploaded scope document. If missing, ask the user to provide it.
sponsor: Identify the sponsor's name. If multiple names appear, ask the user to confirm a single sponsor.
project_lead: Capture the name of the project lead (usually the logged-in PM). If missing, default to the current user.
start_date: Parse the project start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD). If only month/year is given, set the date to the first day and flag for confirmation.
end_date: Parse the project end date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD). If only month/year is given, set the date to the last day and flag for confirmation.
vision: Summarize the high-level vision or objectives of the project.
problem: Describe the problem or opportunity addressed by the project.
description: Provide a brief narrative description of the project including context and goals.
scope_in: List the items explicitly included in scope. Derive from bullet lists labelled 'In Scope'. If absent, ask the user for scope details.
scope_out: List the items explicitly excluded from scope. Derive from bullet lists labelled 'Out of Scope'. If absent, ask the user for exclusions.
risks: Capture the known project risks. Extract bullets labelled 'Risks' or ask the user to specify.
assumptions: Capture any project assumptions. Extract bullets labelled 'Assumptions' or ask the user to specify.
milestones: For each project phase (Initiate, Planning, Execution, Closure), capture deliverables and dates. If a date is missing, leave it blank and ask for confirmation.
success_metrics: List success metrics with three parts: benefit, metric, and system of measurement. Reject vague items without a metric.
core_team: Create one entry per team member with name and role. If responsibilities are provided, include them; otherwise leave blank.
